resources.string: The Brooklyn Bridge, completed in 1883, is one of New York City’s most iconic landmarks, connecting Manhattan and Brooklyn with its majestic stone towers and sweeping cables.
Central Park, located in the heart of Manhattan, is a sprawling urban oasis featuring scenic walking paths, lakes, gardens, and iconic landmarks, offering a peaceful escape from the city’s hustle.
Grand Central Terminal, opened in 1913, is a historic New York City landmark known for its stunning Beaux-Arts architecture, celestial ceiling, and bustling train concourse.
